Class Actor

java.lang.Object
javafx.scene.Node
javafx.scene.Parent
javafx.scene.Group
com.example.demo.actors.Actor.Actor
All Implemented Interfaces:
Destructible, javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget
Direct Known Subclasses:
ActorLevelUp, Boss, BossTwo, EnemyPlaneOne, EnemyPlaneTwo, HeartItem, Projectile, Shield, UserPlane
public abstract class Actor extends javafx.scene.Group implements Destructible
The Actor class serves as the base class for all in-game actors. It provides core functionality for rendering, movement, health management, and collision handling. Subclasses should define specific behavior by implementing the abstract updateActor method.

  • Constructor Details

    • Actor

      public Actor(String imageName, int imageHeight, double initialXPos, double initialYPos, int maxHealth)
      Constructs an Actor with specified initial properties.
      Parameters:
      imageName - the name of the image file used to represent the actor
      imageHeight - the height of the image
      initialXPos - the initial X-coordinate of the actor
      initialYPos - the initial Y-coordinate of the actor
      maxHealth - the maximum health of the actor

  • Method Details

    • updatePosition

      public void updatePosition()
      Updates the actor's position based on its movement component.

    • updateActor

      public abstract void updateActor(double deltaTime, LevelParent level)
      Updates the actor's behavior and state. This method must be implemented by subclasses.
      Parameters:
      deltaTime - the time elapsed since the last update, in seconds
      level - the current level in which the actor exists

    • getMovementComponent

      public MovementComponent getMovementComponent()
      Retrieves the movement component of the actor.

      the movement component

      imageName - the name of the new image file

    • getProjectileXPosition

      public double getProjectileXPosition(double offset)
      Computes the X-coordinate for a projectile fired from the actor.
      Parameters:
      offset - the offset from the actor's current X-coordinate
      Returns:
      the X-coordinate of the projectile

    • getProjectileYPosition

      public double getProjectileYPosition(double offset)
      Computes the Y-coordinate for a projectile fired from the actor.
      Parameters:
      offset - the offset from the actor's current Y-coordinate
      Returns:
      the Y-coordinate of the projectile
